entities.name: UNITED STATES
entities.description: Federal, state, and local governments in the United States have enacted numerous data privacy and security laws.

entities.name: CALIFORNIA CONSUMER PRIVACY ACT OF 2018
entities.description: A law that gives California residents the right to access, delete, and opt-out of certain sharing of their personal information, and to receive detailed information about how it is used and shared.

entities.name: CALIFORNIA PRIVACY RIGHTS ACT OF 2020
entities.description: A law that expands California's privacy laws in 2023, restricting the use of certain categories of sensitive personal information, cross-contextual advertising techniques, and the retention of personal information.

entities.name: CALIFORNIA PRIVACY PROTECTION AGENCY
entities.description: An agency established to impose administrative fines under the California Privacy Rights Act of 2020.

entities.name: VIRGINIA
entities.description: A state that passed the Consumer Data Protection Act, which differs from the CPRA and becomes effective in 2023.

entities.name: COLORADO
entities.description: A state that passed the Colorado Privacy Act, which differs from the CPRA and becomes effective in 2023.

relationships.relationship_description: CCPA is a data privacy and security law enacted in California, a state in the United States.
CPRA expands California's privacy laws beyond those established by CCPA.
The CPRA established the California Privacy Protection Agency to impose administrative fines.
Virginia is a state in the United States that passed the Consumer Data Protection Act.
Colorado is a state in the United States that passed the Colorado Privacy Act.
